entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose one of the bonded creatures. If you and the target are on the same plane of existence, you magically teleport to the nearest unoccupied space next to the creature. You can use this benefit once, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. If your Crown of Horns feature is active when you use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, the use isn't expended.

entries.name: Hand of the King
entries: While your Crown of Horns feature is active, the first time a bonded creature damages another creature during its turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Philosopher
entries: {@i Distill the Essence of Creation}

Philosophers have focused their study of wizardry on the fundamental nature of existence and reality. They seek the most quintessential truths of creation and manipulate those forces and substances through alchemical practice. Through understanding, deconstruction, and reconstruction, they master the natural energies of the world around them and alter it to their will.

Every Wizard who walks the steps of the Philosopher does so to solve some specific problem, even if only at first. The Philosophical Pursuits table offers challenges or goals that set you onto your study of alchemical magic.

entries.caption: Philosophical Pursuits
rows: Someone close to you is lost in time, the planes, or some other esoteric state of being. Unraveling the nature of reality is your path to finding them.
You suffered a debilitating ailment or injury and turned to the study of magic to deconstruct the impairment's nature and transmute it.
Your teacher was killed by a rival Philosopher, and you must learn all you can of that discipline to protect yourself and bring them to justice.
The rediscovered research of a missing mage unlocked the first secrets of your understanding but contains many more you can't yet decipher.
Wizardry provides a path to immense power, but you know an even greater state of being awaits your ascension.
You encountered a material with miraculous properties, and you can't rest until you discover the secret of its creation.
Your sibling's soul was separated from their body in a spell gone wrong, and you cannot forgive yourself until you make them whole.
You were a stage performer who wowed audiences with magical acts, and you seek the ultimate magic trick to become a legend.
You come from an impoverished hometown and wish to utilize the transmutation of metals to bring prosperity to your community.
In your pursuit to be closer to the gods, you have sought the secrets of creating new life forms in your own image.
You were raised to revere the four elements, and you hypothesized that mastering the stuff of existence will bring harmony to them all.
You had aspirations of joining the military and rising through the ranks, believing that the magic of reality can be used as a weapon of war.

subclassFeature.name: Alchemical Knowledge
entries: You gain a set of {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}. You have proficiency with it and can use it as an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB}. Additionally, you can use {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} instead of the normal tool to craft a magic item.

subclassFeature.name: Quintessence
entries: You have learned the fundamental process of dissolution. You know the {@spell Dissolution|CrookedMoon24} cantrip. A creature or object you reduce to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with the cantrip is destroyed. If the target was Small or larger, it dissolves into a measure (1 ounce) of crystalline powder called Quintessence. You can have a maximum amount of Quintessence equal to twice your Intelligence modifier  at one time (mimium of 2 measures). If you create more, the oldest measure vanishes. You can use Quintessence you are touching in the following ways.

entries.name: Material Component
entries: When you cast a spell, you can expend Quintessence to serve as the spell's Material components up to a value of 100 GP per Quintessence expended.

entries.name: Reagent
entries: When you scribe a spell into your spellbook, or when you use {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB} to craft a magic item, you can expend Quintessence to serve as 50 GP worth of material for the task per Quintessence expended.

entries.name: Vitriolic Enhancement
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can expend 1 Quintessence as an additional Material component to change one damage type the spell deals to Force.

subclassFeature.name: Albedo
entries: You can purify your Quintessence to amplify your spells. When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can expend 1 Quintessence as a Material component to increase the level of the spell slot by 1, up to level 9. The maximum Quintessence you can expend in this way on a given spell is half of your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} (rounded up).

subclassFeature.name: Citrinitas
entries: You can now manipulate Quintessence to create, not merely to purify. You always have the {@spell Creation|XPHB} and {@spell Fabricate|XPHB} spells prepared, and you can cast each spell once without expending a spell slot, regaining the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you cast a spell using this feature, you can cast the spell as an action rather than its normal casting time. You can also cast the spells normally using spell slots of the appropriate level. Additionally, when you cast {@spell Creation|XPHB}, you can expend a number of Quintessence up to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to multiply the spell's duration by 1 plus the amount expended.

subclassFeature.name: Rubedo
entries: The culmination of your great work, you can now distill your perfected knowledge of existence into a physical form. When you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can expend 10 Quintessence to create a philosopher's stone—a translucent red crystal. The stone is a Tiny magical object with AC 19, HP 20, and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage except Force. If you create a second philosopher's stone, the first one vanishes. While you carry the stone, it grants you the following benefits.

entries.name: Amplification
entries: When you cast a spell, you can expend up to 2 Quintessence as an additional Material component to increase your spell save DC for that spell by the same amount.

entries.name: Equivalent Exchange
entries: When you fail a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to expend 5 Quintessence to succeed on the save instead.

entries.name: Longevity
entries: You stop aging and don't suffer any effects from old age, including dying from it.

entries.name: Sympathy
entries: The stone counts as part of your body for the purpose of the {@spell Scrying|XPHB} spell and for spells that restore you to life if you die. The stone itself serves as the Material component for the spell (if any) and is destroyed when the spell is cast.

subclassFeature.name: Occultist
entries: {@i Seek Beyond the Stars for Forbidden Knowledge}

Wizardry urges the relentless pursuit of knowledge that pushes every boundary in search of greater power and understanding, but some boundaries are never meant to be crossed. Occultists care not for these limitations, peering behind cosmic veils, devouring forbidden secrets, and pushing their understanding of spellcraft until reality itself tears open. It is from the strange, alien realms that are revealed which they draw even greater power, shattering all limits no matter the eldritch consequences.

Every Wizard who walks the steps of the Occultist does so to solve some specific problem, even if only at first. The Philosophical Pursuits table offers challenges or goals that set you onto your study of alchemical magic.

entries.caption: Philosophical Pursuits
rows: Someone close to you is lost in time, the planes, or some other esoteric state of being. Unraveling the nature of reality is your path to finding them.
You suffered a debilitating ailment or injury and turned to the study of magic to deconstruct the impairment's nature and transmute it.
Your teacher was killed by a rival Occultist, and you must learn all you can of that discipline to protect yourself and bring them to justice.
The rediscovered research of a missing mage unlocked the first secrets of your understanding but contains many more you can't yet decipher.
Wizardry provides a path to immense power, but you know an even greater state of being awaits your ascension.
You encountered a material with miraculous properties, and you can't rest until you discover the secret of its creation.
Your sibling's soul was separated from their body in a spell gone wrong, and you cannot forgive yourself until you make them whole.
You were a stage performer who wowed audiences with magical acts, and you seek the ultimate magic trick to become a legend.
You come from an impoverished hometown and wish to utilize the transmutation of metals to bring prosperity to your community.
In your pursuit to be closer to the gods, you have sought the secrets of creating new life forms in your own image.
You were raised to revere the four elements, and you hypothesized that mastering the stuff of existence will bring harmony to them all.
You had aspirations of joining the military and rising through the ranks, believing that the magic of reality can be used as a weapon of war.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Knowledge
entries: In your study of proscribed power, you learn Deep Speech or another language of your choice.
In addition, choose a level 1 spell from the Warlock spell list. You always have it prepared. You can change your chosen spell when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Intrusion
entries: Your search into the forbidden reaches beyond the universe yields great power but comes at the risk of letting something from beyond intrude into your reality.

You have an Intrusion Die, which starts at a {@dice d6}, that can change as you use your features. The die can increase or decrease, along this progression of die sizes: {@dice d2}, {@dice d3}, {@dice d4}, {@dice d6}, {@dice d8}, {@dice d10}, {@dice d12}.
The size maximum for your Intrusion Die is its starting size, which increases by one step when you reach Wizard levels 5 ({@dice d8}), 11 ({@dice d10}), and 17 ({@dice d12}).
When you use a feature that risks Intrusion, roll your Intrusion Die. On a 2 or higher, no Intrusion occurs, and the Intrusion die reduces in size one step on the progression.
On a roll of 1, the Intrusion Die rises in size one step, and you roll on the Intrusion table to determine what happens as reality fractures. Intrusions use your spell save DC.

The Intrusion Die increases in size by one step (up to its starting size) when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and it resets to its starting size when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Additionally, you can focus alien potency into your spells. When you cast a spell using a spell slot, you can risk Intrusion to choose one of the following.

entries.name: Overwhelming Mind
entries: One target of the spell has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the first saving throw made against it.

entries.name: Seeking Eye
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack roll you make for the spell.

entries.caption: Intrusion
rows: You feel a presence behind you that whispers incomprehensible things into your soul. Until the end of your next turn, you can only do one of the following on a turn: take an action, a Bonus Action, or move.

Space twists and melts in a 30-foot Emanation around you. Each creature (including you) in the area struggles against the warping of reality. An affected creature's Speed is halved until the end of your next turn.

The nearest other creature within 60 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take Necrotic damage equal to two rolls of your Intrusion Die (at its starting size), and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.
Reality tears in your space until the end of your next turn. You and each creature that can see the tear must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Frightened condition while the tear exists.

One of your arms warps into an alien appendage, such as a distorted version of an arm or a twisting tentacle, for 1 minute. You can make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} with the limb using your spell attack bonus. Instead of the normal damage, roll a number of your Intrusion dice (at its starting size) equal to your Proficiency Bonus. The target takes Acid damage equal to the total rolled.
Alien landscapes overlay your vision, giving you the Blinded condition until the end of your next turn.
Unnatural thoughts disorient you, giving you the Incapacitated condition until the end of your next turn.
You experience an instant of terrible clarity. You take Psychic damage equal to two rolls of your Intrusion Die (at its starting size), and for 1 minute, your spell save DC is increased by 2.
You regain an expended spell slot of level 5 or lower (your choice), and you take Necrotic damage equal to twice the slot's level. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

When you cause this Intrusion and at the end of each of your turns for 1 minute, pulses in the fabric of space fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from you, giving you and each creature in it the Prone condition.
For 1 hour, you hear whispered, disembodied thoughts of hateful scorn directed at you. While you can hear the whispers, you have Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that rely on Wisdom.

An Aberration or a Fiend with a CR equal to your Wizard level or lower (GM's choice) appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. The GM decides the creature's attitude (Hostile/Indifferent/Friendly) and actions.

subclassFeature.name: Reality Tear
entries: Choose a spell of level 3 or lower from the Warlock spell list. You always have the spell prepared. You can change your chosen spell when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. When you cast the spell, you can risk Intrusion to remove the need to Concentrate on it, and the spell ends after 1 minute or its normal duration, whichever is shorter. Additionally, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to cast the spell once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Occult Presence
entries: When you cause an Intrusion, you can roll twice on the Intrusion table and choose which result to use, and you can negate the Intrusion by gaining 1 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level. Additionally, you gain one of the benefits below, and you can change your chosen benefit when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to change your chosen benefit.

entries.name: Alien Consciousness
entries: You gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions, and you can't be possessed.

entries.name: Cosmic Resistance
entries: You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic and Psychic damage.

entries.name: Spatial Domination
entries: You gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and can hover.

subclassFeature.name: Beyond Space
entries: The nature of distance and location is revealed for the lie that it is. You always have the {@spell Scrying|XPHB} spell prepared.
When you cast {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, you can risk Intrusion to choose one of the following.

entries.name: All Knowing
entries: Treat your connection to a target creature as if you have part of its body.

entries.name: All Seeing
entries: Cast the spell as an action instead of its normal casting time.

When you cast {@spell Scrying|XPHB}, during the spell's duration, you can cause an automatic Intrusion (and increase the die's size one step, up to its starting size) to teleport yourself, and any willing creatures within 10 feet of you, to unoccupied spaces you can see through the scrying sensor. Once you teleport in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Crimson Sorcery
entries: {@i Control the Vital Power of Your Lifeblood}

Crimson Sorcerers harness the ancient magic of blood and life essence. They twist and guide the flow of this quintessential energy as a hunger grows deep within them. They manipulate their power to infuse the vitality of others, or they can rip it away and steal it for themselves.

Crimson sorcery can be acquired in a variety of ways. Some with this power were born with it. Others were infused with it through a dark ritual or grim event. There are those who discover it through lost secrets.
Consult the Crimson Origins table for a possible origin of your power.

There are a variety of ways you might have received the ability to harness your Crimson Sorcery to manipulate vitality and life essence. The Crimson Origins table offers suggestions of where your power comes from.

entries.caption: Crimson Origins
rows: One of your parents was a vampire. Though you aren't one yourself, you inherited their hunger, and it drives your magic.
You studied blood rites at a monastery that infused your own blood with power.
You survived a vampire's bite, though it left you forever changed and awakened your sorcery.
Your family suffers under a generational curse that has reared its head with you, driving you to drain vital energy.
You studied the secrets of life and death, perhaps to save yourself or a loved one. In so doing, you unlocked the crimson power in your blood.
You died, and a cunning entity offered you a second chance at life. You accepted and awoke with crimson sorcery coursing through your veins.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Well
entries: You hold a reserve of vital energy called your Blood Well, which you can use to empower your magic and fuel other powers from this subclass. When you deal damage or restore {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to a creature, you can expend your Blood Well to add {@dice 1d8} to the total for one target.
You regain your expended Blood Well when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or when a creature takes 10 or more Necrotic damage from you at one time.

subclassFeature.name: Crimson Spells
entries: When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Crimson Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Crimson Spells
rows: {@spell Aid|XPHB}, {@spell Blood Bolt|CrookedMoon24}, {@spell Cure Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, {@spell Blood Sacrifice|CrookedMoon24}
{@spell Crimson Harvest|CrookedMoon24}, {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB}
{@spell Death Ward|XPHB}, {@spell Sacrificial Siphon|CrookedMoon24}
{@spell Field of Reaping|CrookedMoon24}, {@spell Mass Cure Wounds|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Pool of Blood
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend your Blood Well to magically dissolve into a pool of blood, along with everything you're wearing or carrying, for 1 hour. The transformation ends early if you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or if you choose to end it (no action required).
While you are a pool of blood, you use your game statistics with the following changes.

items: You gain Climb and Swim Speeds equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and you can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.
You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.
You can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks.
You can enter and occupy the space of another creature.
You can't drop, use, or otherwise interact with anything you were carrying or holding.
You can't talk, manipulate objects, attack, or cast spells.

subclassFeature.name: Scarlet Vigor
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage. In addition, when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can expend your Blood Well to reduce your {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} level, if any, by 1.

subclassFeature.name: Vital Siphoning
entries: You can feed on your own life essence to fuel your magic. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} Die and choose one of the following benefits.

entries.name: Blood Boil
entries: You regain the use of your Blood Well.

entries.name: Crimson Pulse
entries: Expend your Blood Well to make the next Metamagic option you use this turn cost no Sorcery Points.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguine Feast
entries: Your hunger for vital essence is unquenchable. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can unleash tendrils of blood that lash any creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you. A target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d8} Necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If your Blood Well is already expended when you use this action, the targets have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw. If at least one creature takes damage from Sanguine Feast, you regain a number of {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage roll.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, unless you spend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.

entries.name: Variant: Bloodless Crimson Sorcerers
entries: If you're playing a character from a species that lacks blood in the traditional sense, you can still take the Crimson Sorcery subclass. The essence of Crimson Sorcery is lifeforce, or animating energy that approximates life.

subclassFeature.name: Sinner
entries: {@i Deal in Vice to Jinx Foes and Bend Luck}

Vice clings to Sinners like a second skin—cheating, drunkenness, and games of chance are their bread and blood. A scoundrel by nature, sin calls their name, and when whispers of malefic powers reach their ears, they listen. Those powers offer more than temptation; they grant the tools to deceive, steal, and even kill with a precision these rogues never dreamed of.

Perhaps it begins with a meeting in a seedy saloon, a ritual under desert skies, or a cursed temple found deep in the jungle. No matter the road, the end is always the same: Jinxcraft. Through hexes, curses, and foul magic, Sinners cast aside judgment and righteousness. The laws of man and gods are nothing to them. Only the cold comfort of the path of sin remains.
Sinners wield their Jinxcraft through a wide variety of jinxed items that serve as magical weapons. The Jinx Weapon Forms table offers suggestions for how your jinx weapon might appear.

entries.caption: Jinx Weapon Forms
rows: A wooden, glyph-covered talisman carved into the shape of a pistol that fires magenta blasts
A pair of bone dice that shoot ghastly green bursts of jinxcraft from their pips
Enchanted playing cards that can be thrown with explosive magical power
A lucky coin that launches toward foes when flipped and always returns

subclassFeature.name: Hex Slinger
entries: When you deal damage to a creature with your Sneak Attack, you can unleash the power of your Jinxcraft. When you roll your Sneak Attack dice, designate two of the dice before the roll (such as rolling them separately or using different colored dice). The total rolled on these dice determines the effect of your Jinxcraft as noted on the Hex Slinger Jinxes table. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

entries.caption: Hex Slinger Jinxes
rows: {@b Snake Eyes.} On the target's next turn, it can only do one of the following: move or take an action or a Bonus Action. If it targets you or your allies with an attack on that turn, it takes 2d6 Psychic damage.
{@b The Nightmare.} The target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn, and it must immediately take a Reaction to move as far as it can away from you, up to its Speed.

{@b Whiskey Bottle.} The target drops anything it's holding. Until the end of its next turn, when the target picks up an item, it must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or drop the item immediately.
{@b Cheap Shot.} Until the end of its next turn, the target's Speed is halved, and for that duration, attack rolls against it have Advantage.
{@b Withered Arm.} Until the end of its next turn, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage} on {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} that rely on Strength.
{@b Bad Luck.} Until the end of its next turn, when the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw, it subtracts 1d6 from the total.

{@b Dead Man.} If the next attack roll you make before the end of your next turn misses, it hits instead. If that first attack roll hits, the attack is automatically a Critical Hit. If you roll a 20 on the d20, roll the attack's damage dice three times instead of twice.

subclassFeature.name: Get Jinxed
entries: You have learned the secret art of Jinxcrafting—drawing magical power from the dark deeds and deals of sin. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Cards and Bones
entries: You gain proficiency with two Gaming Sets of your choice ({@item playing cards|XPHB} and {@item dice set|XPHB|dice} recommended).

entries.name: Jinx Weapon
entries: As a 1-hour ritual using a {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}, you magically create a jinx weapon that channels your Jinxcraft. This weapon takes the form of a {@item Pistol|XPHB} or a {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (which uses Pistol game statistics). For you, the jinx weapon ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading} and creates its own ammunition that deals Force damage. In {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} form, you throw cards, dice, or other {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} pieces, or you use them to unleash bolts of hex magic. Alternatively, you can imbue Jinxcraft into a Simple or Martial weapon you have proficiency with, turning it into your jinx weapon. The infused jinx weapon deals Force damage instead of its normal type. If you create a second jinx weapon, the first vanishes or its Jinxcraft ends.

entries.name: Parlor Trick
entries: You learn one of the following cantrips of your choice: {@spell Dancing Lights|XPHB}, {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB}, {@spell Minor Illusion|XPHB}, {@spell Mysterious Presence|CrookedMoon24} , or {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB}. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

subclassFeature.name: Borrowed Luck
entries: When you use Hex Slinger, you siphon away a sliver of the target's luck. You gain {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} if you don't already have it. If you do have it, you can expend your {@variantrule Heroic Inspiration|XPHB} instead of expending a use of Hex Slinger.

subclassFeature.name: Pick Your Poison
entries: When you use Hex Slinger, you can roll the designated Sneak Attack dice twice and choose which total to use.
If the roll you choose is the same number on both dice, the target takes Psychic damage equal to half your level. If the roll you choose is a 2 or a 12, you don't expend that use of Hex Slinger.

subclassFeature.name: The Other Side
entries: You can call on your otherworldly friends in low places to change the odds of anything you do in your favor. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Crossroads Devilry
entries: When you miss with an attack roll or fail a saving throw, you can expend and roll any number of your Sneak Attack dice (choose the number before you roll) and add the total rolled to the attack or save, potentially turning a miss into a hit or failure into success. Expended dice return after you next use your Sneak Attack.

entries.name: Lady Luck's Smiling
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can expend and roll any number of your Sneak Attack dice (choose the number before you roll) and add the total rolled to your AC against that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss. Expended dice return after you next use your Sneak Attack.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Pestilent Haze
entries: {@i Spread Virulent Plague with a Touch}

Warriors of the Pestilent Haze draw plague into their very beings, folding it into their energy and becoming one with the disease. Monks who follow this tradition wander, often following or even preceding waves of pestilence. Some walk with caution, their touch measured, unleashing sickness only where dense populations must be culled. Others revel in the miasma spreading as far and fast as possible.

Your Miasmic Plague is a unique magical contagion that can take many forms that you weave through your deep connection to the affliction. The Plague Manifestations table offers suggestions for what magical form your signature disease takes as it spreads, as well as its hallmark symptoms.

entries.caption: Plague Manifestations
rows: {@b Bloodbreath.} Bruise-colored miasma, the edges of which form into slithering tentacles—painful bruises and a hoarse, bloody cough
{@b Drone Spew.} Swarm of monstrous, mutated flies that buzz with a horrifying drone—bleeding ears and intense vomiting
{@b Festergut.} Viscous, gray sewer water that leaves a film on surfaces—intense stomach pain, dehydration, and blood loss
{@b Gutterpox.} Globs of toxic, greenish sludge that oozes erratically to the touch—swollen, green papules and oppressive mucus buildup
{@b Knell Fever.} Hot wind that prickles the skin and howls with the sound of a tolling bell—heat blisters and feverish hallucinations
{@b Rotface.} Numerous spiked, fungal spores that float through the air—rapid rotting of flesh, especially around the eyes and mouth
{@b The Unclean.} Undulating mass of pallid flesh, teeth, and tongues—grotesque, mutated growths such as new tentacle-like appendages and gnashing mouths
{@b Toadscale.} Infected rains filled with venomous, spectral toads—hardened, itchy patches of scaly skin that turn vibrantly colorful and fits of agonized croaking
{@b Verminplague.} Scurrying mass of ravenous, spectral plague rats that gnaw and scratch victims—painful boils and pustules and an incessant, squeaking cough
{@b Yellow Death.} Billowing, skull-shaped clouds of foul- smelling fumes with a sickly yellow hue—debilitating fatigue, muscle aches, and sunken, sallow skin

subclassFeature.name: Contagious Discipline
entries: You have brewed and concentrated disease within yourself and can now push manifestations of it outward. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Claws of Pestilence
entries: Your nails grow into a set of vermin-like claws. You can deal Slashing damage when you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} instead of Bludgeoning damage. When you hit a creature with an attack granted by your Flurry of Blows, you deal extra Necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.

entries.name: Miasmic Plague
entries: When you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can expend 1 Focus Point to force the creature to succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed for 1 minute. While cursed, the creature has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition, and it takes extra Necrotic damage from your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes} equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
If you forego the extra damage granted by Claws of Pestilence, you can use Miasmic Plague without paying its Focus Point cost.

subclassFeature.name: Gift of Pestilence
entries: Through your observation and meditation, you are attuned to the nature of pestilence and the creatures believed to carry it. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Inoculation
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition or magical contagions, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison and Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Vermin Kinship
entries: Through chittering sounds and hand gestures, you can communicate simple concepts to vermin, such as rats, pigeons, and insects, and you gain the ability to decipher their noises and motions. Vermin lack the intelligence to convey or understand sophisticated concepts, but {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} vermin could relay what they have seen or heard in the recent past. Additionally, you can cast {@spell Animal Messenger|XPHB} using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability targeting a Tiny Beast that is considered vermin and thought to spread plague and disease. Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Plague
entries: The strain of your plague becomes more virulent and deadly. When you deal Necrotic or Poison damage, you ignore the target's {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to those damage types, if any.

subclassFeature.name: Tolling Censer
entries: You can unleash a cloud of miasma upon your enemies. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend 2 Focus Points to unleash a cloud of miasma in a 20-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you. Each creature of your choice in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Necrotic damage equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die and is cursed by your Miasmic Plague. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

subclassFeature.name: Miasmic Contagion
entries: The strength of your Miasmic Plague has increased, granting you the following benefits.

entries.name: Choking Miasma
entries: Constitution saving throws against your Miasmic Plague have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Scurrying Spread
entries: When you expend 1 Focus Point to use your Step of the Wind, until the end of the turn, when you enter a space within 5 feet of any creature of your choice, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be cursed by your Miasmic Plague. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Epidemic
entries: Your plague has reached the height of its potency and its symptoms rapidly afflict your foes. Your Miasmic Plague ignores a target's {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. Additionally, when you deal Necrotic damage to a target cursed by your Miasmic Plague, it takes extra Necrotic damage equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.

entries.name: Fabled Heirloom
entries: Each Fabled Heirloom is a magic item that grows in strength as its attuned owner gains power. The rarity of each heirloom increases as the character grows in level, as shown on the Heirloom Rarity table. An heirloom's description details the properties it always has, as well as the properties it gains as it increases in rarity. The heirloom has all the properties of its rarity and lower.

entries.name: Lingering Curses
entries: Ending your Attunement to one of these items removes its curse, but the power of a Cursed Curio doesn't release its hold on the user easily. If you attune to it again within 28 days, the progression of its curse returns to where it was before you ended your Attunement.

item.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Rare)
entries: This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor's edge and lined with dark fire. It's handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes. You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe's rarity. You can also use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiery Smite (Rare+)
entries: This axe deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes {@dice 1d10}.

item.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Very Rare)
entries: This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor's edge and lined with dark fire. It's handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe's rarity. You can also use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiery Smite (Rare+)
entries: This axe deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes {@dice 1d10}.

entries.name: Mark of Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

entries.name: Sense Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to hold the blade of the axe to a creature's neck (if it has one), and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the axe's bonus) or you learn something the creature feels guilty about. Once this property is used, the target is immune to it for 24 hours.

item.name: Axe of the Galloping Headsman (Legendary)
entries: This axe has a wickedly curved head, honed to a razor's edge and lined with dark fire. It's handle is wrapped in cracked leather, and the entirety is etched with malevolent runes. You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the axe's rarity. You can also use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiery Smite (Rare+)
entries: This axe deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Fire damage on a hit. If the target is a creature that damaged you since the end of your last turn, the extra damage becomes {@dice 1d10}.

entries.name: Mark of Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the axe, you can mark it for punishment (no action required). You know the direction and distance to the creature. If it leaves this plane of existence, you know the destination plane and the mark ends. The mark otherwise ends when this property is used again, or when the target dies.

entries.name: Sense Guilt (Very Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to hold the blade of the axe to a creature's neck (if it has one), and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the axe's bonus) or you learn something the creature feels guilty about. Once this property is used, the target is immune to it for 24 hours.

entries.name: Dark Binding (Legendary)
entries: Once during your turn when you hit a creature with the axe, you can immediately take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to force the target to succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or have the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} and {@condition Prone|XPHB} conditions until the start of your next turn. If its body shape allows it, the target kneels and presents its neck.

entries.name: Executioner's Blade (Legendary)
entries: When you attack a creature with the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition using the axe, you score a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}. On a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}, the axe deals an extra {@damage 3d6} Fire damage, and if the creature is left with 20 or fewer {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} after taking this damage, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or die.

item.name: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Rare)
entries: An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol' Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells; you gain a +1 bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks; and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiendish Lure (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, choose one Fiend or Humanoid that you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the banjo's bonus) or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition (ignoring a demon's {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}) for 1 minute. The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Scarecrow's Dance (Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

item.name: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Very Rare)
entries: An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol' Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells; you gain a +2 bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks; and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Fiendish Lure (Rare+)

The {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends if you or your allies deal damage to the target or force it to make a saving throw. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Scarecrow's Dance (Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to strum the banjo and dance wildly to take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action. The music is audible within 120 feet.

entries.name: Join in the Dance (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use Scarecrow's Dance, one creature of your choice that you can see within 15 feet of you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

item.name: Banjo of Ol' Jericho Sticks (Legendary)
entries: An old, weathered banjo inscribed with runes, this instrument once belonged to Ol' Jericho Sticks, a scarecrow bard created by a hag coven.

While holding the banjo, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells; you gain a +3 bonus determined by its rarity to spell attack rolls, your spell save DC, and Charisma ({@skill Performance|XPHB}) checks; and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Birdcage (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic} action, you can force a creature you have {@condition Charmed|XPHB} to make a DC 19 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature disappears, drawn into the banjo. The banjo can contain one creature at a time in this way for up to 24 hours. On a success, the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition ends on the creature.

item.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother (Rare)
entries: This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.

While holding the bell, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Dolorous Tolling (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ring the bell, producing an ominous tolling. Creatures of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the bell's bonus). On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d10} Psychic damage, and for 1 minute, when it makes an attack roll or saving throw, it must subtract {@dice 1d4} from the total. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother (Very Rare)
entries: This heavy iron handbell is elaborately decorated with filigree. Its handle is a large ring, and its clapper hangs from a chain within. Its only sound is ever-mournful tolling.

While holding the bell, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by its rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Dolorous Tolling (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ring the bell, producing an ominous tolling. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Call of the Bell (Very Rare+)
entries: You can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to create a doll (use the {@creature Animated Armor|XMM} stat block) from a 5-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of wood, clay, or stone within 10 feet. The doll obeys your commands and acts immediately after your turn on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. It reverts to the materials used to create it after 10 minutes or when it dies. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Bell of the Dusk Mother (Legendary)

The doll obeys your commands and acts immediately after your turn on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}. It reverts to the materials used to create it after 10 minutes or when it dies. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Death Knell (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can ring the bell, creating a loud clang. Each {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB} creature in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d10} Necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Rare)
entries: This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner's weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a {@item Musket|XPHB} that ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}, and it can make its own ammunition that deals Necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the blunderbuss's rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use the blunderbuss as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Jinxshot (Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a blast from the blunderbuss that forces each creature within a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone} to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss's bonus), taking {@damage 2d4} Necrotic damage (Rare) or {@damage 3d6} Necrotic damage (Very Rare+) on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

item.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Very Rare)
entries: This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner's weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a {@item Musket|XPHB} that ignores {@itemProperty LD|XPHB|Loading}, and it can make its own ammunition that deals Necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the blunderbuss's rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use the blunderbuss as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Sinner's Jinx (Very Rare+)
entries: Once during your turn when you damage a creature with the blunderbuss, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss's bonus) or be cursed for 1 minute. When it makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} while cursed, it subtracts {@dice 1d4} from the total. The curse ends if this property is used on another creature.

item.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner (Legendary)

When it makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} while cursed, it subtracts {@dice 1d4} from the total. The curse ends if this property is used on another creature.

entries.name: Luck Taker (Legendary)
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that is cursed by this weapon makes a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} and rolls a 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to mimic their luck. The next time you make a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} within 1 minute, change the number you roll on the {@dice d20} to the triggering number.

item.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Rare)
entries: This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

While holding the cane, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Eldritch Glutton (Rare+)
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to consume the spell and store its energy in the cane. The spell has no effect on you. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times the spell's level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Very Rare)
entries: This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to three times the spell's level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Allure of Sin (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the cane's bonus) from the cane. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by the spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald (Legendary)
entries: This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

entries: You can cast {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the cane's bonus) from the cane. Once a creature is {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by the spell, this property can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sin-Binder's Call (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon three Hell Hounds, one Incubus, or one Succubus. They appear in unoccupied spaces you can see within 30 feet of you, obey your commands, and take their turns immediately after yours on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. After 10 minutes, they no longer obey you, but if you treated them well, they are {@variantrule Indifferent [Attitude]|XPHB|Indifferent} or {@variantrule Friendly [Attitude]|XPHB|Friendly} toward you. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Rare)
entries: The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus determined by the cauldron's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Size Change (Rare+)
entries: You can perform a 1-minute ritual to change the cauldron's size from Tiny to Medium, or from Medium to Tiny. It weighs 1 lb. when Tiny and 80 lb. when Medium. As a Medium object, its feet can move. It has a {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} of 20 feet and moves when you command it during your turn (no action required).

entries.name: Cookpot (Rare+)
entries: As part of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can use the Medium cauldron to prepare food for up to ten creatures. At the end of the rest, each creature that eats gains {@dice 2d6} {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Vermincall (Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can spill liquid from the cauldron to cast {@spell Conjure Animals|XPHB} with it. The conjured spirits take the form of grotesque insects or rats. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Very Rare)
entries: The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus determined by the cauldron's rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Fortifying Gorge (Very Rare+)
entries: When you use the Cookpot property, one creature of your choice who eats gains a +2 bonus to AC until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. During this time, the creature's skin is hardened and monstrous.

item.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven (Legendary)

entries: When you use the Cookpot property, one creature of your choice who eats gains a +2 bonus to AC until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. During this time, the creature's skin is hardened and monstrous.

entries.name: Coven Abomination (Legendary)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can drink from the cauldron or administer a draught from it to a creature within 5 feet. For 1 hour, the drinker of the thick, sickly-sweet liquid becomes Large if it is currently smaller than that, its reach increases by 5 feet, and its melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} damage. When the effect ends, the creature has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition for 1 minute from the agony of its bones shrinking slower than its flesh.

item.name: Crown of the Barrow King (Rare)
entries: This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

While you wear the crown, you gain a +1 bonus determined by the crown's rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for Necromancy spells and spells that deal Necrotic damage, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Demand of the Dead (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} from the crown.

entries.name: Grave Grasp (Rare+)
entries: You know the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} cantrip. Your spell attack bonus with it is +9 (Rare), +10 (Very Rare), or +11 (Legendary).

entries.name: Necromancer's Call (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Crown of the Barrow King (Very Rare)
entries: This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

While you wear the crown, you gain a +2 bonus determined by the crown's rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for Necromancy spells and spells that deal Necrotic damage, and you can use the following properties.

entries: You can cast {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} from the crown.

entries: You can cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Master of Undeath (Very Rare+)
entries: Undead that you create or summon have twice as many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as normal and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws.

entries.name: Soul Transfer (Very Rare+)
entries: When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fail a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can transfer your soul into an Undead that you created and that is within 1 mile of you (no action required). Your previous body dies instantly. Your new body has none of your possessions except the crown. You use your game statistics, except the target Undead's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} replace your current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Crown of the Barrow King (Legendary)

entries.name: Necromancer's Call (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Animate Dead|XPHB} from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Master of Undeath (Very Rare+)
entries: Undead that you create or summon have twice as many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} as normal and have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws.

entries.name: Soul Transfer (Very Rare+)
entries: When you drop to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or fail a {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB}, you can transfer your soul into an Undead that you created and that is within 1 mile of you (no action required). Your previous body dies instantly. Your new body has none of your possessions except the crown. You use your game statistics, except the target Undead's current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} replace your current {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Compel Undead (Legendary)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can choose an Undead within 30 feet of you. It must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. It obeys your commands while {@condition Charmed|XPHB} in this way, and the condition ends early when the creature is {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

item.name: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch (Rare)
entries: A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy "The Kutlass" Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity. While holding the cutlass, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Raise the Stakes (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, choose a creature within 5 feet of you and mark it until the start of your next turn. Count the number of times you hit the target and the number of times it hits you while the mark lasts. If you hit the target more times, it takes {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. If it hits you more times, you take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. If your hits are tied, you both take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sea Legs (Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement until the end of that turn.

item.name: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch (Very Rare)
entries: A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy "The Kutlass" Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.
You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity. While holding the cutlass, you can use the following properties.

If it hits you more times, you take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. If your hits are tied, you both take {@damage 2d10} Psychic damage. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Sea Legs (Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} doesn't cost you extra movement until the end of that turn.

entries.name: Double Down (Very Rare+)
entries: When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you can make one additional attack against a target marked by the Raise the Stakes property.

entries.name: Jinxcraft Panache (Very Rare+)
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to increase your AC against that attack by twice the cutlass's bonus to attack and damage rolls if the creature already dealt damage to you on this turn.

entries.name: Hex Ward (Legendary)
entries: You can't be targeted with Divination spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and a creature that curses you takes Psychic damage equal to your level.

item.name: Eye of the White Worm (Rare)
entries: This fist-sized eyeball is cold and clammy to the touch. It is milky-white with purple veins, and its pupil constantly searches for something.

While holding the eye, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the eye's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Thought Scour (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the eye's bonus) from the eye. When you probe deeper into a creature's mind, it takes {@damage 3d8} Psychic damage unless it is a willing target. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Eye of the White Worm (Very Rare)
entries: This fist-sized eyeball is cold and clammy to the touch. It is milky-white with purple veins, and its pupil constantly searches for something.

While holding the eye, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the eye's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Thought Scour (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the eye's bonus) from the eye. When you probe deeper into a creature's mind, it takes {@damage 3d8} Psychic damage unless it is a willing target. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Mnemonic Siphon (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Modify Memory|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the eye's bonus) from the eye. When you do, you gain a version of the affected memory as if you experienced it yourself, though you still know the memory isn't yours. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Violation of the Real (Very Rare+)
entries: When you cast a Conjuration spell using a spell slot that deals damage, or that summons a creature that can deal damage, the spell or creature deals an extra {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage to one target the first time it deals damage during a turn.

entries: When you cast a Conjuration spell using a spell slot that deals damage, or that summons a creature that can deal damage, the spell or creature deals an extra {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage to one target the first time it deals damage during a turn.

entries.name: Enduring Violation (Legendary)
entries: When you cast a Conjuration spell with a duration of 1 hour or more, you can extend the duration to 24 hours, and the spell no longer requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

item.name: Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth (Rare)
entries: This cloak was made from the hide of a reptilian magma Fiend, incomparable in its destructive power. Flame now shies away from it, for one who has mastered such a titanic creature can master its element.
While wearing this cloak, you gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} and Constitution saving throws determined by the cloak's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Deep-Dweller (Rare+)
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage and a {@variantrule Burrow Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}. Once during your turn when you emerge from burrowing, each creature in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the hide's bonus), taking {@damage 2d8} Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Infernal Roar (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Fear|XPHB} (save DC = 16 + the hide's bonus) from the cloak. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

item.name: Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth (Very Rare)
entries: This cloak was made from the hide of a reptilian magma Fiend, incomparable in its destructive power. Flame now shies away from it, for one who has mastered such a titanic creature can master its element.

entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can exhale hellfire in a 30-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the hide's bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d6} Fire damage and {@damage 4d6} Necrotic damage, and it can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half damage only. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.

entries.name: Pernicious Fire Immunity (Legendary)
entries: Fire actively avoids you. You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Fire damage. When you are the target of an attack that deals Fire damage, the attack randomly targets another creature within the attack's range, which can include the attacker. When you make a saving throw against an effect that deals Fire damage, you must choose one other creature that is also making the saving throw against that effect. It has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the save.

item.name: Hook of the Tall Man (Rare)
entries: This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.
You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the hook's rarity. While holding the hook, you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Snare (Rare+)
entries: When you hit a creature with the hook, you can activate the {@itemMastery Topple|XPHB} mastery property in addition to a different mastery property you're using with it.

entries.name: Fey Haunt's Stride (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} from the hook, and when you do so, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on your next Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) check made before the end of your next turn. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

item.name: Hook of the Tall Man (Very Rare)
entries: This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.

This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses when you roll {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}.

entries.name: Strike from Shadows (Very Rare+)
entries: When you start your turn with the {@condition Invisible|XPHB} condition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the first attack you make on your turn, even if the condition ends before you make the attack. If that attack hits, it deals an extra {@damage 2d6} Piercing damage.

entries.name: Hunter's Hook (Legendary)
entries: When you hit with an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} made with the hook, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage, and its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 until the end of the turn.

entries.name: Terrifying Stride (Legendary)
entries: Immediately after you use the Fey Haunt's Stride property, you can choose a creature within 20 feet of you. It must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. While {@condition Frightened|XPHB} in this way, the creature can't take the {@action Disengage|XPHB} action.

item.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight (Rare)
entries: Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.

While holding the idol, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the idol's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Rotting Touch (Rare+)
entries: You can use your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}, and on a hit, your strike deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Necrotic damage (Rare), {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage (Very Rare), or {@damage 1d10} Necrotic damage (Legendary).

entries.name: Touch of Oblivion (Rare+)
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can't be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} instead.

item.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight (Very Rare)
entries: Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.

entries.name: Hallucinatory Spores (Very Rare+)
entries: When you cast a spell using a spell slot or from the idol, you can choose one creature that you can see within 10 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the idol's bonus) or take {@damage 2d6} Psychic damage and have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Rot in the Flesh (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Barkskin|XPHB} from the idol targeting only yourself. For the duration, a creature that hits you with a melee attack roll takes {@damage 1d8} Necrotic damage. Once the spell is cast from the idol, it can't be cast from it again until the next dusk.

item.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight (Legendary)

entries.name: Hollow with Rot (Legendary)
entries: When you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} from a spell, you also gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the spell's level.

item.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Rare)
entries: This ornate Hooded Lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.

While you hold the lantern and it is lit, you gain a +1 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) and Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks determined by the lantern's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Ghostly Flame (Rare+)
entries: The lantern doesn't require fuel, and it sheds blue-green light. It casts {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 30-foot radius and {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} for an additional 30 feet. You can snuff or ignite its light as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} while you are within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Revealing Flame (Rare+)
entries: Creatures in the Border Ethereal within the area of the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} are visible to creatures on the Material Plane. When a creature within the lantern's {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} is possessed or affected by the {@spell Magic Jar|XPHB} spell, the creature in control appears overlaid on the body in a spectral form.

item.name: Lantern of the Chained Reaper (Very Rare)
entries: This ornate Hooded Lantern was once a weapon in the hands of the Chained Reaper, filled with ghastly balefire. Able to pierce the veil, the lantern reveals a glimpse at things hidden from mortal eyes.

entries.name: Mystic Sight (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} from the lantern. The spell ends early if you extinguish the light or aren't holding the lantern.

entries.name: Summon Spirit (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon a {@creature Ghost|XMM} that appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. The ghost obeys your commands, and it takes its turn immediately after you on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. The ghost vanishes after 1 minute, or when it dies. You can't use the lantern's properties, except for Ghostly Flame, during this time.

entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|XPHB} from the lantern. The spell ends early if you extinguish the light or aren't holding the lantern.

entries.name: Summon Spirit (Very Rare+)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can summon a {@creature Ghost|XMM} that appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. The ghost obeys your commands, and it takes its turn immediately after you on your {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count. The ghost vanishes after 1 minute, or when it dies. You can't use the lantern's properties, except for Ghostly Flame, during this time.

entries.name: Balefire (Legendary)
entries: You can cast {@spell Scorching Ray|XPHB} (level 5 version, +11 to hit) from the lantern. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

entries.name: Warding Light (Legendary)
entries: The lantern's area of {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} offers the protection of a {@spell Magic Circle|XPHB} spell. This protection can't operate in the reverse direction, and it ends if you aren't holding the lantern or if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.

item.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Rare)
entries: This wooden fool's scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

While holding the marotte, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the marotte's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Coulrophobia (Rare+)
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw to avoid the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the creature that created the effect to make the same saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Fortune's Fool (Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} (save DC = 16 + the marotte's bonus) from the marotte. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk. You regain use of the spell early if you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.

item.name: Marotte of the Lord of Fools (Very Rare)
entries: This wooden fool's scepter is painted with vibrant, unsettling colors that depict a grinning face. While no creature is attuned to the marotte, the face looks like the infamous Chuckles, the Lord of Fools.

While holding the marotte, you can use it as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your spells, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the marotte's rarity, and you can use the following properties.

entries.name: Coulrophobia (Rare+)
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw to avoid the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to force the creature that created the effect to make the same saving throw. On a failed save, it has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dusk. You regain use of the spell early if you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20} for a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}.

entries.name: Fool's Motley (Very Rare+)
entries: You can cast {@spell False Life|XPHB} from the marotte. Any clothing or armor you wear looks like a fool's motley for the duration of the spell.

entries.name: Slapstick (Very Rare+)
entries: When a creature is affected by a {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter|XPHB|Hideous Laughter} spell you cast, you can choose another creature. When that creature deals damage to the target of the spell, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} rather than {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on its saving throw to end the spell.
